description: Replace each prime factor of n by 2: a(n)=2^bigomega(n).
comments: The inverse Möbius transform of A162510. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 09 2011
links: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
R. J. Mathar, Survey of Dirichlet series..., arXiv:1106.4038, eq. (2.12)
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d divides n} 2^(bigomega(d)-omega(d)) = Sum_{d divides n} 2^(A001222(d) - A001221(d)). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 30 2002a(n) = A000079(A001222(n)), i.e., a(n)=2^bigomega(n). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Feb 13 2005Totally multiplicative with a(p) = 2. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Oct 04 2006Dirichlet g.f.: Product_{p prime} 1/(1-2*p^(-s)). - _Ralf Stephan_, Mar 28 2015
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 29 2001
